Text: RE PLEASE READhave a commodity futures account with Alaron in Chicago and it is administered by Millenium Trust in Chicago I have not traded in the last two years and plan on closing the account soo n Jim Reyes Original Message From Enron NRON mailtoIMCEANOTESEnronAnnouncementsCorpEnron NRONcom On Behalf Of Mark Taylor Vice President and General CounselENRON Sent Tuesday June PM To NYMEX Hedge Exemption NRON Subject PLEASE READ To Department ENA Legal From Mark Taylor Date May Vice President and General Counsel Subject Enron North America Corp NYMEX Hedge Exemption Applications We are in the process of preparing applications for position limit exemptio ns for ENAs NYMEX energy commodities futures trading These applications require that ENA represent whether its officers employees owners or agen ts have a power of attorney control or have a financial interest in any relat ed commodity futures account either individually or acting with another pers on pursuant to express or implied agreement Please direct any responses to my paralegal Tana Jones via intercompany email or call her at by the end of business on June if you have any power of attorney control or have a financial interest in any commodity futures account other than an ENA or other trading affiliate account IF YOU DO NOT HAVE A COMMODITY FUTURES ACCOUNT YOU DO NOT NEED TO RESPOND TO THIS REQUEST

RE Green Power Cc To answer your question I am not the person who can Specifically I need the contact information for the EES utility liaison or the person at the utility who is responsible for verifying metering accuracy at this site The meter from the Wind units is sent to the ISO I dont know how it is sent in but the ISO in turn sends the meter to our meter group in Houston I have no idea who physically manages this transaction Jim Original Message From Ring Richard Sent Tuesday November AM To Reyes Jim Cc Pitt Lisa Subject FW Green Power Jim Are you going to be able to answer Lisas questions Richard Original Message From Pitt Lisa Sent Tuesday November AM To Reyes Jim Cc Ring Richard Subject Green Power Kathleen Croiset informed me that you were the contact for metering issues at Green Power The following email was sent to Richard Ring If you are better suited to address my inquiry please let me know Forwarded by Lisa PittEWCEnron on AM Lisa Pitt AM OLE Object Picture Device Independent Bitmap To Richard nronXGate cc Michael PayneENRON NRONDEVELOPMENt Subject Green Power Asset Management is in the process of updating site information and seeking documentation of revenue meter testing at Green Power Marion did not know who I should request this information from and suggested that I start with EES All the other projects have a stipulation in their agreements requiring utilities to undertake testing of their metering equipment to verify the accuracy of such equipment If testing reveals that the equipment is outside of a specified range then the utility will calibrate the meter I am looking to send a request for evidence or certification of such testing at Green Power Specifically I need the contact information for the EES utility liaison or the person at the utility who is responsible for verifying metering accuracy at this site If you know of anyone who can assist with this matter please forward their contact information to me Thanks

Update PGES Load Meter Cc NonPrivilegedpst This is what I found Waheed A Ahmad of CSC has records of entering PGES into Sparky Apparently this did not occur Pete Davis ran meter scout and we have confirmations everyday except the th On June Reyes ran both Meter Validation and Schd Vs Meter for several days including the th the lack of data for PGES wasnt picked up th was checked off During April actualization Anc Charges and deviation variances for the th were not flagged and addressed Today Chris Stokley calls me and asks why there is no meter in the system That is what happened on Jim Reyes

FW ISO Files Cc poNonPrivilegedpst Pete Chris Stokley called me regarding Meter data on for PGES What we received from the ISO does not include meter in our data base yet below you can see there was meter for PGES We ran the schedule to meter report and the data is missing from this report I will also find the emails reporting sending this to the ISO We need to determine what part of the process broke down keeping the data from being reported Jim Original Message From Reyes Jim Sent Tuesday July AM To Stokley Chris Subject FW ISO Files Here is the source of the last file I sent to you Jim Original Message From ENRON mailtoIMCEANOTESwahmadcscEcom NRONcom Sent Friday June AM To Reyes Jim Subject ISO Files file is attached If you should have any questions please do not hesitate to contact me See attached file stlCAvloadtoPWXcsv Thanks Waheed A Ahmad stlCAvloadtoPWXcsv

FW Settlement Files and NonPrivilegedpst Murray and Chris The following is more detail on what had occurred below In running the metervalidation tool I noticed on a Monday there was a lower than average meter for load zone SDG San Diego It was reported at when a typical weekday is around I phoned Pat and we discussed what was occurring and we noticed that Sat was reported at Sat Typically weekends days run at in SDG Pats explanation doesnt fully explain why the weekend would slide one day And just in time we discovered it If you need more information please let me know I just reran the meter validation and the correct values are placed in and Jim Original Message From Reyes Jim Sent Thursday July PM To ONeil Murray P Stokley Chris Subject FW Settlement Files and I discovered this error and had Pat send us an email explaining the reason the Meter was wrong as well as updating the data They updated this within the days Jim Original Message From mailto Sent Thursday July AM To Carter Pamela Phillips George Reyes Jim Cc Subject Settlement Files and Jim the above settlement files were misstated due to an error in tracking weekend vs weekdays The original file showed the data for to be a normal load for a weekday while reflected the load for a weekend The problem has been corrected and the files for and were reposted The file for was reposted on day

FW Settlement Files and NonPrivilegedpst I discovered this error and had Pat send us an email explaining the reason the Meter was wrong as well as updating the data They updated this within the days Jim Original Message From mailto Sent Thursday July AM To Carter Pamela Phillips George Reyes Jim Cc Subject Settlement Files and Jim the above settlement files were misstated due to an error in tracking weekend vs weekdays The original file showed the data for to be a normal load for a weekday while reflected the load for a weekend The problem has been corrected and the files for and were reposted The file for was reposted on day

EES Average ISO costNonPrivilegedpst Chris I used the Volume from either or to calculate the average price for various charge types Look at OportlandwestdeskvolumemanagementvolmgntJimEES MonthlyAverage Rate Analysis EESxls Chris I can do this for PGES too I want to make sure this is what you need in terms of data Let me know if you need PGEs Jim

Analysis of PeakNon PeakNonPrivilegedpst Hi Chris Look at the file called Flash EESxls It is saved in the directory I told you OPortlandWestdeskVMVMJimEES Monthly I created a pivot table and a formula to separate Peak from Off Peak on the flashLook it over it covers June and July If this is some thing you want it takes about min per spreadsheet Let me know if you want this kind of analysis and what months and in what order you want Jim

FW FW CAISO Notification MDASOnline ChangesNonPrivilegedpst I send this to Pete Is there someone on FSPVMS who should know about these changes to Meter collection Poston Jim Original Message From Davis Pete Sent Wednesday June AM To Reyes Jim Subject Re FW CAISO Notification MDASOnline Changes Jim I have passed this information on to the group Mike Marryott that will be making the appropriate changes to the Meter Scout I dont own that application in the FSPVMS world at least for now The Meter Scout will have to be rewritten to handle the new procedures Pete From Jim nronXgate on AM To Pete CT cc Subject FW CAISO Notification MDASOnline Changes Pete Did you see this email Is there anything we need to do to prepare Want to discuss Jim Original Message From CRCommunications ENRON mailtoIMCEANOTESCRCommunicationsCCRCommunicationscaisoEcomE NRONcom Sent Tuesday June PM To ISO Market Participants Cc TSWG Subject CAISO Notification MDASOnline Changes Overview The California ISO is enhancing two of its meter data systems scheduled to be in production by October The objective of this development effort is to provide the ISO with robust flexible maintainable and more costeffective metering systems to meet its everchanging market and internal needs Market participants and other systems will use the internet based MDASOnline application for meter data submission and requests Timeline for project Market Simulation August through August Production Implementation October Impacts of project New interface for MDASOnline o Same look and feel as new OASIS interface Multiple valid file formats o MDEF and CSV file formats for meter data submission and requests No longer use FTP to submit MDEF files o Interim FTP service for file submission during transition o File submission only no FTP acknowledgements or requests Automation specification will be provided o Submission of meter data file o Download of meter data file submission status o Download of meter data Additional equipment and software o Smart Card security o Netscape Navigator browser ECN connection no longer required for meter data submission and requests o The file submission and reporting will take place over a secure internet connection No formal training required o Online help in application o MDAS Operators o System Support Questions will be addressed at the next TSWG Conference call PST or send inquiries to Leslie Feusi at

Energy CT and Excess Energy CT Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator phone pager alpha page email mailto Original Message From Stokley Chris mailtoChris NRONcom Sent Tuesday June PM To Cc Reyes Jim Subject RE Activity Charges Keoni I realize that there are no penalty charges associated to Load I am referring to the neg and positive load deviation What are all of the charges associated to the penalties for deviation from schedule Ps Jim take your best cut at what you think these charges are and then get Keoni too sign off on what results you come up with We need to put every charge that we think is linked to a schedule and then just have Keoni fill in the gaps and sign off on the document Chris Original Message From Reyes Jim Sent Tuesday June PM To Stokley Chris Load Meter Cc NonPrivilegedpst Pete Last week I resubmitted meter data to the ISO for The files CSC placed out there are still there after I resubmitted Are you the one to delete the files after resubmittal I spoke with Pat and that was her understanding Any files over days are held in suspense until we delete them even if they have been sent to the ISO Correct my understanding if this is not the case If it is the case you can delete the files for ees and pges Jim

RE Settlement file Cc po NonPrivilegedpst Pat This email is to follow up on our phone conversation for Meter Data on PGES zone SDG The average for this zone runs around that day meter for that zone is Looking for your investigative answer Jim Original Message From ENRON mailtoIMCEANOTESppriestcscEcom NRONcom Sent Thursday May AM To Reyes Jim Subject Settlement file Jim I left you a message regarding settlement file The original file was a good file and was only sent the one time Do you still need the data again

RE Bad Meter File from EES eesdatNonPrivilegedpst Per CSC this should be resolved Jim Original Message From Davis Pete Sent Wednesday May AM To Stokley Chris Reyes Jim Subject Bad Meter File from EES eesdat Jim Chris The meter file from EES eesdat contained bad information for the Start and Stop Time in the Meter Header section EES needs to correct this problem and send a new file If EES does not understand what Im talking about they can call me Pete

Question about load zones Cc poNonPrivilegedpst Pat I have been reviewing the Meter Vs Load Validation Report we use to keep an eye on Load Schedule vs Meter Data I have been running these reports daily since We have found the following information missing from the reports from All the missing information is for PGES Zone MID and SMD is missing both Load Sch and Meter Zone PGE PGE PGE are missing Meter Data Due to all the issues we have been experiencing lately we want to make sure that all the data is complete Could you let me know via email what you know about these zones and why we are missing this data Thank you Jim
Revised Meter issues document Cc NonPrivilegedpst Murray As you requested here is more information on who is responsible for the meter variances in March Changes are in blue
March Meter Data Cc NonPrivilegedpst The following documents my conversation with Pat Priestly and why Load Meter data is faulty thru the month of March Jim

Excel Mock UpNonPrivilegedpst I got the queries to extractand through this MockUp of the data in Excel for you two to review They are in the Volume Management common directory but here is an attachment of the file I created views of each Transaction Type E A or MAs we anticipated the Revenue balances with the Expense for each type Jim

Status of Access Settlement Analysis ProjectNonPrivilegedpst Murray and Chris Here is an update on what has been completed and what needs to be completed First I moved the Excel mock up to PVolumeManagementSettlement Stats I added Murrays corrections and reconstructed the Mock Report In the same directory you will find an Access Database Settlement Analysis DB I created a table and a report and a form to create a report There is a hard copy of the report at my desk The various connections need to established and I took a first shot at where the information is stored on the Oracle database The reports that I believe will populate the table are FSPSETLMTHISTORYHDRS FSPSETLMTHISTDTLQTY I have taken a shot at what fields I believe these come from relate to the table I need help in populating the tables and then some coaching on how to create a program feel to create a report based on selection criteria We can meet tomorrow to review where my work is Jim
Excel Mockup of Settlement DBNonPrivilegedpst Here is the latest Excel mockup of the Settlement Analysis DB Jim
Heres the development Template for DBNonPrivilegedpst Heres a first take on the parameters for the DB we are creating to analyze Contract Variances

Re Approval is Overdue Access Request for Cc NonPrivilegedpst Yes in my new role I am performing settlement duties that require my access to Global Facilities Should you have any more concerns please contact my manager Chris Stokley Jim Rhonda L Denton AM To Jim CT cc Subject Approval is Overdue Access Request for Is there a purpose for your use of Global Facilities These facilities are for wholesale power delivery Forwarded by Rhonda L DentonHOUECT on AM ARSystem on PM To cc Subject Approval is Overdue Access Request for This request has been pending approval for days and you are the alternate Please click srrsauthemailLinkaspIDPageApproval to review and act upon this request Request ID Approver Request Create Date PM Requested For Resource Name Global Facility North America Power Resource Type Applications
HA Congestion Cc Bill NonPrivilegedpst Darren RT and stCal desks have decided to divide the congestion cost between the two desks We need a manual entry to adjust this Jim

RE CongestionEnpower to CAPS varianceBill NonPrivilegedpst Darren was looking at an old report We reran the report and it balanced which makes sense Thanks for your patience while Darren runs up the steep learning curve Jim Original Message From Williams III Bill Sent Monday August AM To Cavanaugh Darren Reyes Jim Cc Symes Kate Subject CongestionEnpower to CAPS variance Jim and Darren We relieved Path congestion for HE on Saturday morning We flowed mws from Malin to FC This resulted in the mw variance in the report I have added deals to Enpower to flatten the report these deals are only necessary for the sake of the report The identical variance in the north and south indicates a wheel or load shift I prefer to not enter these extra deals Please see me with questions if you do not understand why the report variance exists Thanks Bill

RE Congestion Cc poBill NonPrivilegedpst As indicated we got that exact amount in the flash today Original Message From Williams III Bill Sent Tuesday August AM To Blair Kit Emmert Caroline Lee Eugene Nelson Kourtney ONeil Murray P Purcell Mike Reyes Jim Sheidun Donna Stokley Chris Thompson Virginia Subject Congestion Jim I just wanted to bring to your attention the volume of congestion that we relieved last night It looks like mws at and mws at This should be at total revenue of Please see me with any questions Thanks Bill

ADS Cards Cc poBill NonPrivilegedpst I copied the request form from docshtml Here is the smart card formwe need to have these cards as soon as possible Could you contact me and let me know when the cards are sent out Jim Reyes

Path Con HA Cc Bill NonPrivilegedpst Bill Marina and I took a sample of when we change Path HA Con The sample covered Last Week in May and first two weeks in April All the entries net added revenue to your book I know this is a little coy but I suppose you dont care if it is in your favor If it is an expense talk to you Apparently the trades are relieving Con on path That is probably you guys right Let me know what you think Jim

RE Supp DeclineBill NonPrivilegedpst Thanks Bill Original Message From Williams III Bill Sent Monday June AM To Reyes Jim Johnson Donna Subject RE Supp Decline Jim Harbor and Martel were declined with the CISO for HE and HE The reasons for Harbor the CISO incd them to and ignored their operating limits as entered at and Martel was incd but could not ramp up Both bids were properly entered by were ignored by the CISO Delano was incdd and decd several times in the morning and was able to respond Let me know if you have any other questions Thanks Bill Original Message From Reyes Jim Sent Monday June AM To Williams III Bill Subject Supp Decline Bill Could you send me and Donna Shediun an email documenting the Decline to Harbor and Martel Wheel Abrator for supplimental HE interval and Jim
Supp DeclineBill NonPrivilegedpst Bill Could you send me and Donna Shediun an email documenting the Decline to Harbor and Martel Wheel Abrator for supplimental HE interval and Jim
